code: @Manual{,   title = {treestartr: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data},   author = {April Wright},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/treestartr/}, }

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: treeStartR R package auomated generation starting trees total-evidence phylogenetic analyses. Phylogenetic trees, particularly time-scaled phylogenetic trees, increasingly estimated using parameter-rich models evolution [@catmodel; @wright2016] models incorporating macroevoloutionary processes [@fbd]. Finding starting tree computable likelihood perform Bayesian MCMC complex models can challenge, particularly estimation involves many taxa, large datasets, missing data. Different phylogenetic estimation packages allow users find starting trees different ways, estimating tree parsimony (@raxml8) neighbor-joining [@beast2], randomly adding taxa tree [@beast2; @raxml8], allowing user specify tree. Addition taxa usually performed based data - , using algorithm (parsimony neighbor-joining) add tips tree. However, analyses fossil record, specimens may included molecular morphological characters available, taxonomy specimen known via expert opinion. case many specimens harvested via repositories Paleobiology Database. purpose package allow users efficiently add taxa given tree generate reasonable starting tree. Functions package allow taxa added tree according either taxonomy (specimens genus present) function present_tippr, random (rand_absent_tippr), via user-specified groupings (text_placr). package uses functions phytools [@phytools] ape [@ape].

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: Install development version directly Github {r eval=FALSE} library(devtools) install_github("wrightaprilm/treeStartR")

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: First, need load list total set taxa present tree. “total set” refers taxa included analysis. can either CSV TSV file. sample list, bears, provided part bears data object, can also generate one using function dataf_parser. Note higher order taxa, example, placing fossil identified family level, species level, included “family_spp.” treeStartR relies underscore separate higher order lower order taxa. Use consistent formatting tree taxon list - .e, call taxon “Ge_spp” tree “Genus_spp” taxon list. Next, find taxa total set represented tree already. function takes input tree, without branch lengths, without annotations (95% HPDs). also takes total set taxa generated dataf_parser: {r warning=FALSE} absent_list <- genera_strippr(tree, tax_frame)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: Finally, add tips present tree. representatives genera absent taxon (example, adding additional “Ursus” species example tree), taxa used place tip. multiple species genera, new tip subtend recent common ancestor tips already tree. one representative, tip subtend parent node taxon. {r warning=FALSE} new_tree <- present_tippr(tree, absent_list) plot(new_tree) added tips, can check many tips remain added, : {r warning=FALSE} genera_strippr(new_tree, tax_frame)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: can also add tips congeners. function ask input. pop-produced, showing node labels. program asks input, tell node like tip subtend. Alternatively, like place tip sister tip tree, enter number tip. Tip numbers highlighted yellow. {r eval=FALSE} new_tree <- absent_tippr(tree, absent_list)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: , congeners, may choose add tips random: {r warning=FALSE} new_tree <- rand_absent_tippr(tree, absent_list) plot(new_tree) Running command generate second random addition tree, comparing first using RF distance [@Robinson1981], shows us tree topologies truly different. {r warning=FALSE} second_random <- rand_absent_tippr(tree, absent_list) phangorn::RF.dist(new_tree, second_random)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: Lastly, may TSV file specifies tips added, taxon set. treeStartR locate MRCA taxon set, add tips subtending node. {r warning=FALSE} new_tree <- text_placr(tree, mrca_df) plot(new_tree)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: default, treeStartR outputs trees polytomies. placement tips estimated data, rather placed arbitrarily. RevBayes BEAST2 read non-bifurcating trees. working analytical software , may want resolve polytomies export, ape’s multi2di function:

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: tip addition functions, except absent_tippr capability write RevBayes-formatted clade constraint strings. echo_revbayes argument allows . {r warning=FALSE} text_placr(tree, mrca_df, echo_revbayes = TRUE) Likewise, subtrees tips added can printed screen. {r warning=FALSE} present_tippr(tree, absent_list, echo_subtrees = TRUE)

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data
text: final tree can output using standard functions ape, write.nexus() function: {r eval=FALSE} ape::write.nexus(new_tree, file = "data/export_example.tre")

title: Generate Starting Trees For Combined Molecular, Morphological and Stratigraphic Data

code: mrca_list <- c("Ursus_arctos", "Ursus_spelaeus", "Ursus_americanus") tree <- text_placr(tree, mrca_df) #> Placing tip Kretzoiarctos_beatrix #> via relatives Indarctos_arctoides, Indarctos_vireti #>  at node 25 #> Placing tip Ursus_abstrusus #> via relatives Ursus_arctos, Ursus_spelaeus, Ursus_americanus #>  at node 30 echo_sub <- echo_subtree(tree, mrca_list, "Ursus_abstrusus")

Default FALSE. echo_revbayes Boolean; Print clade constraints missing taxa added screen, formatted RevBayes fossilized birth-death analysis. Default FALSE.

what: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
title: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
text: Add tips according csv tsv file taxon names taxa form clade "d like insert tip. One column called 'taxon', contain taxon placed.  column called 'clade' contain taxon   taxon placed form group. member clade placed line. example file can seen `inst/extdat /mrca_df.tsv`

title: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
code: text_placr(tree, mrca_df, echo_subtrees = NULL, echo_revbayes = NULL)

title: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
text: tree Starting tree; object type phylo mrca_df Dataframe containing column taxa like place one column clade like place echo_subtrees Boolean; Print newick subtree missing taxa added screen. Default FALSE. echo_revbayes Boolean; Print clade constraints missing taxa added screen, formatted RevBayes fossilized birth-death analysis. Default FALSE.

title: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
text: tree Phylo object containing starting tree,          tips added.

title: Add tips to tree via taxon list — text_placr
code: text_placr(tree, mrca_df) #> Placing tip Kretzoiarctos_beatrix #> via relatives Indarctos_arctoides, Indarctos_vireti #>  at node 25 #> Placing tip Ursus_abstrusus #> via relatives Ursus_arctos, Ursus_spelaeus, Ursus_americanus #>  at node 30 #>  #> Phylogenetic tree with 17 tips and 19 internal nodes. #>  #> Tip labels: #>   Ailuropoda_melanoleuca, Agriarctos_spp, Kretzoiarctos_beatrix, Indarctos_arctoides, Indarctos_vireti, Ursus_abstrusus, ... #>  #> Rooted; no branch lengths.
